events.message: The insured filed a claim reporting a collision involving their car and another vehicle at an intersection yesterday.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident due to the involvement of motor vehicles in the reported incident.
An insurance agent specializing in auto claims has been assigned to manage this case and assist the customer through the process.
The insurer sent an official acknowledgment to the policyholder confirming receipt of the auto accident claim.
The insurance company requested relevant documentation including the police report, vehicle photos, and repair estimates.
The policyholder provided all requested documents promptly, including the official accident report and repair quotes.
The investigation team started evaluating the submitted documents and inspected the vehicle damage to assess claim validity.
The investigation has been completed confirming the collision details and assessing the liability and damage extent.
A settlement offer was proposed to the claimant based on the findings and repair cost estimates for the car damage.
The customer responded with concerns that the settlement does not fully cover the vehicle repair costs and requested reconsideration.
Due to the customer dispute, the claim was escalated to a senior claims adjuster for further review and negotiation.
The senior adjuster approved an increased settlement amount after reviewing additional repair estimates submitted by the claimant.
The insurance company issued payment to the policyholder covering the approved settlement amount for the vehicle repairs.
Following successful payment and resolution, the claim was officially closed with no further action required.
The auto accident claim files were archived in the system for record-keeping and future reference purposes.
